issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.customfield_12310192: DockerContainerExecutor is deprecated starting 2.9.0 and removed from 3.0.0. Please use LinuxContainerExecutor with the DockerRuntime to run Docker containers on YARN clusters.

fields.summary: The list of -libjars archives should be replaced with a wildcard in the distributed cache to reduce the application footprint in the state store

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: Because the {{DockerContainerExecuter}} overrides the {{writeLaunchEnv()}} method, it must also have the wildcard processing logic from YARN-4958/YARN-5373 added to it.  Without it, the use of -libjars will fail unless wildcarding is disabled.

comments.body: Related-but-different question: [~sidharta-s], [~vinodkv] - what is the long-term plan for DCE given LCE is supporting Docker? Should we consider deprecating it in 2.8?
I would be in favor of deprecating DCE. I'm not sure where it's being used but it's fairly limited in the use cases it supports.
+1 to deprecating DCE in 2.x and removing it altogether in 3.x.
Here's a patch for branch 2 that deprecates {{DockerContainerExecutor}} and fixes what I broke.
And here's a trunk patch that expunges {{DockerContainerExecuter}} from the records.

This message was automatically generated.
The new javadoc warnings are because the class is now deprecated.
I'm in favour of removing DockerContainerExecutor but it should be done via the dev list. We should send out an email to the users and yarn dev lists asking if anyone has objections, etc.

[~templedf] Apologies for the late response. Took at look at the trunk patch - I think {{DockerContainerExecutor.md.vm}} needs to be removed as well. I also see a reference to {{DockerContainerExecutor}} in {{hadoop-project/src/site/site.xml}} .
[~templedf] branch-2 patch : should we update {{DockerContainerExecutor.md.vm}} here as well?

Thanks for the review, [~sidharta-s].  I removed the docs from trunk and slapped a big deprecation warning on the docs in branch-2.  Since there aren't yet docs on using Docker with the LCE, it seemed cruel to strip the DCE docs out entirely.  (See YARN-5258.)

I think we can go ahead with this? There weren't any objections on the mailing list.

+1 on the trunk patch.

For the branch-2 patch, I am not sure we should make the code improvements in DockerContainerExecutor.java.

Post MAPREDUCE-6719, the DCE is broken, and it isn't deprecated before this patch.  I don't think it's reasonable to say that slapping a deprecation label on something absolves us from fixing it when it's broken.  The label says that it will go away in the future, not that it's broken and cannot be used.
Agree with [~templedf] - let's commit the branch-2 changes as well.

My bad. I missed the fix parts of the code in the rest of the unrelated improvements. +1. Checking both in..

(For the unrelated code readability etc. improvements, I always wonder if we should do it in a separate JIRA to avoid confusing folks looking at pulling this patch in later.)
